page.title: 13TWO NURSERY GARDENS
page.content: Though there are no garden centres in our block, we do have two interesting nurseries. An old established family firm in{Little Bytham}grows a wide range of trees, shrubs, fruit, house plants and perennials. It sells from the nursery and at markets in Melton Mowbray and Stamford, and has an excellent reputation locally. The{Careby}nursery, specialising in rare and interesting plants and native wild flowers , opened in 1983. It trades mainly by mail order. Many of its clients are specialist plant collectors, or have famous old gardens. It also supplies schools, botanic gardens and local authorities. Its frequent exhibits at Royal Horticultural Society shows in London have received many awards. The gardens at Careby Manor are open to the public from April to September.
